alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:35PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Calumet and southern Manitowoc Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 535 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brillion, or 16 miles west of Manitowoc, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valders and St. Nazianz around 555 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manitowoc and Cleveland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
